description: Numbers whose square is a palindrome with an even number of digits.
references: C. Ashbacher, More on palindromic squares, J. Rec. Math. 22, no. 2 (1990), 133-135. [A scan of the first page of this article is included with the last page of the Keith (1990) scan]
links: K. S. Brown, On General Palindromic Numbers
P. De Geest, Subsets of Palindromic Squares
M. Keith, Classification and enumeration of palindromic squares, J. Rec. Math., 22 (No. 2, 1990), 124-132. [Annotated scanned copy]
F. Yuan, Palindromic Square Numbers, as of July 2002.
prog: (PARI) is_A016113(n)={vecextract(n=digits(n^2),"-1..1")==n&&!bittest(#n,0)} \\ This is faster (than first checking for even length) if applied to numbers in a range where the squares are known to have an even number of digits (as should be the case for a systematic search). _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 08 2014
crossrefs: Cf. A027829. A proper subset of A002778.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_
extensions: 2 new terms were recently found by Bennett from UK (communication from _Patrick De Geest_).
